text: Michael Leopold Kilby (3 September 1924 – 9 September 2008) was a British Conservative politician who served as a Member of the European Parliament for the East Midlands between 1984 and 1989. Prior to his election as a Member of the European Parliament, he had served as the Mayor of Dunstable in 1963-64. A keen cricketer, he played minor counties cricket for Bedfordshire from 1950-55, making 21 appearances in the Minor Counties Championship. He died in September 2008 at Hawkhurst, Kent. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2008 deaths Category:People from Dunstable Category:English cricketers Category:Bedfordshire cricketers Category:Conservative Party (UK) councillors Category:Conservative Party (UK) MEPs Category:Mayors of places in Bedfordshire Category:MEPs for England 1984–1989
title: Michael Kilby
